How does the negation operator affect the truth values of a tautology with another logical operator?
The negation operator changes the truth values depending on the other logical operator present. For example, A ⊃ B becomes ~(A ⊃ B), and its truth value can be determined from the truth table.

Tautology          A B A ⊃ (A ⋅ BT T         T   T T F         F   F F T         T   F F F         T   F A B (A ⋅ B) ⊃ (~A ⊃ ~B) T T        T    T    T T F        F    T    T F T        F    T    F F F        F    T    T A B (A ⋅ ~A) ⊃ B T T           F   T   T T F           F   T   F F T           F   T   T F F           F   T   F A B (A ⊃ A) ⊃ (B ⋅ ~B) T T        T    F    F T F        T    F    F F T        T    F    F F F        T    F    F A B (A ⋅ B) ⊃ (A v B) T T        T    T    T T F        F    T    T F T        F    T    T F F        F    T    F Answers to exercises  221 6.
Introduction to Logic and Critical Thinking, by Matthew Van Cleave
